Projects 
 
Banking Application Project 
 
Tools & Technologies: Selenium WebDriver, Java, TestNG, Maven, Jenkins, Git, Postman, JIRA, SQL 
 
The project involved automation testing of banking applications offering services such as account management, fund 
transfer, loan processing, and card management. 
 
The goal was to ensure seamless functionality, data security, and performance across multiple modules integrated 
through APIs and web interfaces 
 
Roles and Responsibilities: 
 Analyzed business requirements, functional specifications, and created automation test strategy and test 
plans. 
 
Designed and developed automation scripts using Selenium WebDriver with Java and TestNG for end-to-
end testing of core banking features. 


Implemented Page Object Model (POM) to enhance script reusability and maintainability. 
 
Integrated automation suites with Jenkins for continuous integration and nightly regression execution. 
 
Validated API services using Postman for account, loan, and transaction modules. 
 
Verified backend data integrity through SQL queries against the banking database. 
 
Reported and tracked defects using JIRA, coordinating closely with developers and business analysts for timely 
resolution. 
 
Maintained version control using Git, and participated in code reviews and peer testing. 
 
Conducted regression, smoke, and sanity testing for every build release. 
 
Ensured compliance with banking standards like data encryption, role-based access, and audit trail validation. 
 
Retail Application Project 
 
Tools & Technologies: Selenium WebDriver, Java, TestNG, Maven, Jenkins, Git, JIRA, Postman, SQL 
 
Worked on automation testing of retail web applications covering product search, cart, checkout, payment, and 
order management modules. 
 
Designed and developed automation scripts using Selenium WebDriver with Java and TestNG following the Page 
Object Model (POM) framework. Integrated test suites with Jenkins for CI/CD and executed regression and 
smoke tests for every release. 
 
Responsibilities: 
 Analyzed user stories and created automated test scripts for end-to-end retail workflows. 
 
Performed API testing using Postman for order, payment, and inventory modules. 
 
Validated backend transactions using SQL queries. 
 
Logged and tracked defects using JIRA and participated in sprint reviews. 
 
 Contributed to framework enhancements and code maintenance using Git. 
Declaration 
 
The Above mentioned details are true best of my Knowlesge.

Feb 2018 to Till Date Project 1 : Project Title: Bank of America – Online Banking Application (Nov 2024 – Till Date) Domain: Banking Role: Automation Test Engineer Tools & Technologies: Selenium WebDriver, Cucumber Project Description: Bank of America’s Online Banking Application is a secure, web -based platform designed to provide customers with digital access to core banking services such as account management, fund transfers, loan processing, bill payments, and transaction history. The  system ensures seamless user experience, high availability, and strong data security through multi -tier authentication and encryption. The project’s main focus was on ensuring functionality, performance, and reliability of all banking modules through effe ctive manual and automation testing practices. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Developed and executed automation scripts using Selenium WebDriver integrated with the Cucumber BDD framework to validate core insurance workflows such as policy creation, claims p rocessing, and premium calculations.  Implemented the Page Object Model (POM) design pattern for enhanced test maintainability and scalability across multiple insurance modules.  Configured and triggered CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins using POM.xml to automate  regression suite execution and generate detailed test reports after each build. Utilized GitHub for version control to manage automation scripts and ensure collaborative development and code synchronization among QA teams.  Authored and maintained Cucumber feature files with business-readable Gherkin scenarios covering end-to-end insurance use cases including underwriting and claim adjudication.  Reviewed and analyzed Cucumber test reports to ensure accuracy of automation results and quick identification of defects.  Conducted both Manual and Automation Testing in an Agile environment, participating in daily stand- ups, sprint reviews, and planning meetings to align with business requirements. Performed regression and functional testing on multiple builds using Maven, GitHub, and Jenkins to ensure system stability during policy renewal and claims updates. Project 2 : Project Title: Horizon Health Care Systems (April 2023 – October 2024) Domain: Healthcare Role: Automation Test Engineer Tools & Technologies: Selenium WebDriver, TestNG, Java, Maven, Jenkins, GitHub, JIRA, Agile Methodology Project Description: Horizon Health Care Systems is a web -based healthcare management platform designed to automate and streamline key processes such as patient registration, appointment scheduling, medical record management, billing, and claims processing. The application pro vides a unified system for healthcare providers, insurance partners, and patients to ensure efficient care coordination, reduced manual errors, and faster claim settlements. The project focuses on maintaining data accuracy, HIPAA compliance, and end -to-end system reliability through automated testing. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Designed and developed automation test scripts using Selenium WebDriver with TestNG for healthcare modules like patient management, claims adjudication, and billing workflows.  Implemented Data-Driven and Modular Frameworks to enhance test coverage and maintainability.  Configured Maven for project build management and executed automated test suites efficiently.  Integrated automation scripts with Jenkins CI/CD pipelines to perform scheduled test executions and generate detailed reports.  Utilized GitHub for version control and collaborative test script management.  Conducted Functional, Regression, and Integration Testing to validate application stability across multiple environments.  Authored TestNG annotations for parallel execution and effective test grouping to optimize execution time.  Logged and tracked defects in JIRA, collaborating with developers and business analysts for resolution.  Participated in Agile ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospective meetings to ensure quality deliverables.  Reviewed and validated test reports and logs to identify root causes of failures and ensure continuous test improvement. Project 3 : Client : USAA - United Services Automobile Association (Feb 2018 – April 2023) Role: Manual Tester Domain : Insurance Technologies: Manual Testing Project Description: USAA proudly serves millions of military members and their families with competitive rates on insurance, banking and investment services. Project #2: Diarised Payments- Faster Payments Role: Functional Testing It is a Retail banking project of Diarised payments for Payment Transformation program across the RBS banks in the United Kingdom. To ensure all the new requirements and enhancements required for this project are duly tested by the Functional Testing for ST Phase (System Testing). Diarised Payments Overview:  Diarised Payments includes Faster payments like (Future dated payments) and (Standing order recurring payments) which are getting implemented across RBS banks in the United Kingdom.   These payments will get implemented in all UK brands such as RBS, NWB and UBN.  PAIN001 and PAIN009 is a XML (technical format) message used for payment initiation in Diarised Payments which will be delivered to banks within RBS and other Non- RBS banks. Key Responsibilities:  Understanding the Functional part of testing and the requirements with the help of High Level and Technical Specification documents.  Test scenario documents and Test cases, which ensure functional coverage of the software application.  Preparing Test cases, Performing Execution & Defect Tracking.  Preparing Daily Test Execution Summary Report and sharing it with stakeholders.  Defect logging and Monitoring through JIRA. Tools: IBM RIT, Soap UI, Tortoise SVN, JIRA Project #3: Title: Faster Payments- Core System and Commercial and Private Banking Role: Service Virtualization Engineer In Payments Core Systems there are different components such as DataPower, IIB, WRAPPER and provider systems. The request which was triggered from the front end will travel across these many components and finally it will hit the services which are beyond Wrapper components integrating many micro services. Service virtualization helps address this challenge by simulating unavailable components and microservices, enabling early and continuous testing and thus supporting the shift-left strategy in Quality Assurance. Role and Responsibilities:  Performing feasibility study for virtualization of services and attending the walkthrough calls or gathering the business requirements and created stubs for Dynamic services for different protocols like MQ and HTTPS, virtualized stub through RR pairs and supported End to End and Non- Functional testing based on their requirements.  Analyzing the requirements for identified services and involving in the test data preparation to provide SV and Test automation solutions by Automating Test cases in RIT for Testing.  Provide the technical support across the projects for E2E flow connectivity, Configuration, Deployment and Maintenance of virtual services in respective domains and environments i.e. CIT, ST, SIT, NFT and E2E through RTCP.  Stubs are created for SOAP \XML along with schema validation of WSDL  services, Swift messages and Cobol Copy Book messages and verification of the Agent logs and SV logs in Agent server for troubleshooting purposes and calculate the TPS for analyzing the performance of stubs.  Verify the MQ messages listening status and queue depth analysis using IBM WebSphere Explorer.  Virtualized services like AML, Banktrade, FPFE, Customer DB, Corecredit, RetailFX, Lombard, ESP to support front end micro services and virtualized Cobol copybook services and CicsDPLbridge services. Project Description: BOUI is a web-based application serving as an interface to HRMS (Human Resource Management System) data. BOUI is exposed to both client associates and Hewitt's internal client -specific HRMS Operations teams. test coverage and validation across various data sets.  I am proficient with JUnit and TestNG for test execution, reporting, and managing complex test cases, generating detailed reports for faster feedback.  I have in-depth knowledge of Page Object Model (POM), utilizing POM to create reusable, scalable automation frameworks, improving maintainability and reducing duplication.  I am skilled in BDD with Cucumber, writing clear Gherkin syntax for Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), enabling clear communication between stakeholders and development teams.  I have hands-on experience in Manual Testing, validating functionality, usability, and performance to meet user expectations before automation.  I am proficient in API Testing using Postman, validating REST API responses and ensuring proper integration with backend services.  I am skilled in API Automation with Rest Assured, enhancing test coverage and reducing manual testing efforts for backend validation.  I am experienced in Agile methodologies, actively participating in Agile processes, aligning testing efforts with development sprints to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software.  I am experienced with Jira for defect tracking and bug reporting, ensuring smooth project execution through effective management of test cases and defect tracking.  I am proficient in Continuous Integration with Jenkins, automating test executions within CI pipelines, enabling smoother workflows and faster feedback.  I am an expert in Maven for managing project dependencies, automating builds, and ensuring consistency in testing environments.  I am experienced in Mobile Testing with Appium, automating tests on Android and iOS platforms to ensure cross-platform compatibility and consistent app performance.  I am an expert in writing and executing detailed test cases, ensuring full test coverage and identifying defects early in the development process.  I have a strong understanding of SDLC and STLC, ensuring alignment of testing with development processes for efficient delivery.  I have excellent communication skills, presenting test results, issues, and recommendations, fostering collaboration and informed decision-making.  I am experienced in Regression, Smoke, and Sanity Testing, performing these tests to validate software stability and readiness for production after changes or updates.  I have a strong command of Git for version control, managing and tracking changes in test scripts, ensuring collaboration and reducing conflicts  WORK EXPERIENCE:  Working as a Software Test Engineer in Perficient India Private Limited, Chennai from May 2020 to till date  SKILL SETS:  Language: Core Java  Automation Testing Tool: Selenium WebDriver  Frameworks: BDD-Cucumber, TestNG, Junit, Data Driven, POM and Spring MVC  Defect Management Tool: Jira  Source Code Tool: Git and GitHub  Build Tool: Maven  Api Testing Tool: Postman and Rest Assured  Database Management: SQL  Integration Tool: Jenkins  PROJECT PROFILE:  Project : woolworths Domain: E-Commerce Jan 2021 to till date  Description: Woolworths Supermarkets, or "Woolies," is Australia's largest supermarket chain, founded in 1924 and owned by Woolworths Group. With a 32.5% market share in 2023, it offers a wide range of groceries and household products, serving millions of customers. The company is known for its quality, convenience, and customer service.  Roles & Responsibilities: • Create and maintain automation frameworks using Cucumber, Selenium WebDriver, Appium, and API testing tools for efficient test automation. • Develop Gherkin-based test scenarios with Cucumber for BDD, enhancing collaboration between teams. • Automate functional and regression tests for web and mobile apps using Selenium, Appium, and API tools for comprehensive coverage. • Perform API testing with Postman, Rest Assured, or SoapUI to ensure backend services’ reliability and correctness. • Automate mobile testing for Android and iOS with Appium, Espresso, or XCUITest for cross-platform functionality. • Ensure cross-browser testing for web apps (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) and cross-device testing for mobile apps to ensure compatibility. • Manage test data for web, API, and mobile tests to maintain accuracy and consistency in automated testing. • Implement parallel test execution across browsers, devices, and environments to speed up test cycles and optimize efficiency. • Generate test reports and logs with Allure or Extent Reports for clear test insights. • Collaborate with development, product, and QA teams to align automation tests with business requirements. • Maintain and update test scripts based on changes in UI, APIs, or business logic to keep tests effective and relevant. • Identify and track defects during automated testing, working with developers for timely resolution and quality improvement. • Develop mobile test automation strategies for diverse devices, OS versions, and screen sizes. • Continuously expand automation test coverage to ensure comprehensive validation across web, mobile, and API layers. • Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Git) for faster feedback and continuous testing  Project : EasyJet Domain: Airlines May 2020 to Dec 2020  Description: EasyJet plc is a major British-European low-cost airline, based at London Luton Airport. It operates 927 routes in over 34 countries through its affiliates EasyJet UK, EasyJet Switzerland, and EasyJet Europe. With around 13,000 employees, mainly in the UK, EasyJet is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is part of the FTSE 100 Index.  Roles & Responsibilities:   Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and other stakeholders to review project requirements and ensure a thorough understanding of testing needs and expectations.  Create detailed and well-structured test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements, covering all scenarios, including positive, negative, boundary, and edge cases.  Manually execute test cases on different versions of the application to verify functionality, identify defects, and ensure the system meets the specified requirements.  Identify, document, and report defects found during testing using a defect tracking tool like JIRA, ensuring clear reproduction steps and necessary information for developers.  Perform regression testing to verify that recent code changes have not affected the existing functionality and the application works as intended after updates or fixes.  Conduct smoke testing on a new build to ensure critical functionalities are working, and perform sanity testing to check the functionality of specific features after bug fixes or enhancements.  Engage in exploratory testing to uncover potential defects that are not explicitly covered in the test cases, focusing on areas where test coverage may be limited.  Prepare and manage test data sets, ensuring data reflects real-world usage and test cases are designed to validate both expected and edge-case scenarios.  Identify performance issues through manual testing and highlight any bottlenecks or slow response times, which could affect user experience or application efficiency.  Work closely with developers, product managers, and other team members to communicate identified issues, discuss requirements, and contribute feedback to enhance the product quality.  Maintain comprehensive test documentation, including detailed test cases, test execution logs, defect reports, and status updates, ensuring transparent communication with stakeholders.  Manually test the user interface for consistency, usability, and adherence to design specifications, ensuring that the application provides a seamless and intuitive user experience.  Ensure the software adheres to relevant industry standards, legal requirements, accessibility guidelines, and organizational quality control procedures.  Actively contribute to Agile ceremonies, such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint retrospectives, and backlog grooming, ensuring that testing aligns with project timelines and objectives.   ACADEMIC PROFILE:  Masters in Computer Application from Adhiyamaan College of Engineering at Hosur. (Aug 2015 to Apr 2018)

name: MADHAN KUMAR D
text: MADHAN KUMAR D Mobile: 7010231128  Software Test Engineer Email:  madhankumar0905@gmail.com   OBJECTIVE:  A highly skilled Software Tester with 4.6 years of experience in Manual and Automation Testing (using  Selenium). Adept in bug tracking, test case design, and API testing (with Postman). Proficient in using tools such as  JIRA, Jenkins, and Git. Seeking opportunities for remote, on-site, or hybrid roles to contribute my expertise in   delivering high-quality software solutions.  CAREER SUMMARY:  I have 4.6 years of experience in manual and automation testing for web and mobile applications, ensuring software quality and efficiency across the development lifecycle.  I am proficient in Core Java for writing efficient, maintainable test scripts, integrated with various testing tools and frameworks.  I am an expert in Selenium WebDriver for automating functional, regression, and cross-browser testing, ensuring consistency and cross-browser compatibility.  I am experienced in Data-Driven Testing, skilled in creating data-driven test cases for comprehensive test coverage and validation across various data sets.  I am proficient with JUnit and TestNG for test execution, reporting, and managing complex test cases, generating detailed reports for faster feedback.  I have in-depth knowledge of Page Object Model (POM), utilizing POM to create reusable, scalable automation frameworks, improving maintainability and reducing duplication.  I am skilled in BDD with Cucumber, writing clear Gherkin syntax for Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), enabling clear communication between stakeholders and development teams.  I have hands-on experience in Manual Testing, validating functionality, usability, and performance to meet user expectations before automation.  I am proficient in API Testing using Postman, validating REST API responses and ensuring proper integration with backend services.  I am skilled in API Automation with Rest Assured, enhancing test coverage and reducing manual testing efforts for backend validation.  I am experienced in Agile methodologies, actively participating in Agile processes, aligning testing efforts with development sprints to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software.  I am experienced with Jira for defect tracking and bug reporting, ensuring smooth project execution through effective management of test cases and defect tracking.  I am proficient in Continuous Integration with Jenkins, automating test executions within CI pipelines, enabling smoother workflows and faster feedback.  I am an expert in Maven for managing project dependencies, automating builds, and ensuring consistency in testing environments.  I am experienced in Mobile Testing with Appium, automating tests on Android and iOS platforms to ensure cross-platform compatibility and consistent app performance.  I am an expert in writing and executing detailed test cases, ensuring full test coverage and identifying defects early in the development process.  I have a strong understanding of SDLC and STLC, ensuring alignment of testing with development processes for efficient delivery.  I have excellent communication skills, presenting test results, issues, and recommendations, fostering collaboration and informed decision-making.  I am experienced in Regression, Smoke, and Sanity Testing, performing these tests to validate software stability and readiness for production after changes or updates.  I have a strong command of Git for version control, managing and tracking changes in test scripts, ensuring collaboration and reducing conflicts  WORK EXPERIENCE: Working as a Software Test Engineer in Perficient India Private Limited, Chennai from May 2020 to till date  SKILL SETS:  Language: Core Java  Automation Testing Tool: Selenium WebDriver  Frameworks: BDD-Cucumber, TestNG, Junit, Data Driven, POM and Spring MVC  Defect Management Tool: Jira  Source Code Tool: Git and GitHub  Build Tool: Maven  Api Testing Tool: Postman and Rest Assured  Database Management: SQL  Integration Tool: Jenkins  PROJECT PROFILE: Project : woolworths Domain: E-Commerce Jan 2021 to till date  Description: Woolworths Supermarkets, or "Woolies," is Australia's largest supermarket chain, founded in 1924 and owned by Woolworths Group. With a 32.5% market share in 2023, it offers a wide range of groceries and household products, serving millions of customers. The company is known for its quality, convenience, and customer service.  Roles & Responsibilities: • Create and maintain automation frameworks using Cucumber, Selenium WebDriver, Appium, and API testing tools for efficient test automation. • Develop Gherkin-based test scenarios with Cucumber for BDD, enhancing collaboration between teams. • Automate functional and regression tests for web and mobile apps using Selenium, Appium, and API tools for comprehensive coverage. • Perform API testing with Postman, Rest Assured, or SoapUI to ensure backend services’ reliability and correctness. • Automate mobile testing for Android and iOS with Appium, Espresso, or XCUITest for cross-platform functionality. • Ensure cross-browser testing for web apps (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) and cross-device testing for mobile apps to ensure compatibility. • Manage test data for web, API, and mobile tests to maintain accuracy and consistency in automated testing. • Implement parallel test execution across browsers, devices, and environments to speed up test cycles and optimize efficiency. • Generate test reports and logs with Allure or Extent Reports for clear test insights. • Collaborate with development, product, and QA teams to align automation tests with business requirements. • Maintain and update test scripts based on changes in UI, APIs, or business logic to keep tests effective and relevant. • Identify and track defects during automated testing, working with developers for timely resolution and quality improvement. • Develop mobile test automation strategies for diverse devices, OS versions, and screen sizes. • Continuously expand automation test coverage to ensure comprehensive validation across web, mobile, and API layers. • Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Git) for faster feedback and continuous testing  Project : EasyJet Domain: Airlines May 2020 to Dec 2020  Description: EasyJet plc is a major British-European low-cost airline, based at London Luton Airport. It operates 927 routes in over 34 countries through its affiliates EasyJet UK, EasyJet Switzerland, and EasyJet Europe. With around 13,000 employees, mainly in the UK, EasyJet is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is part of the FTSE 100 Index.  Roles & Responsibilities:   Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and other stakeholders to review project requirements and ensure a thorough understanding of testing needs and expectations.  Create detailed and well-structured test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements, covering all scenarios, including positive, negative, boundary, and edge cases.  Manually execute test cases on different versions of the application to verify functionality, identify defects, and ensure the system meets the specified requirements.  Identify, document, and report defects found during testing using a defect tracking tool like JIRA, ensuring clear reproduction steps and necessary information for developers.  Perform regression testing to verify that recent code changes have not affected the existing functionality and the application works as intended after updates or fixes.  Conduct smoke testing on a new build to ensure critical functionalities are working, and perform sanity testing to check the functionality of specific features after bug fixes or enhancements.  Engage in exploratory testing to uncover potential defects that are not explicitly covered in the test cases, focusing on areas where test coverage may be limited.  Prepare and manage test data sets, ensuring data reflects real-world usage and test cases are designed to validate both expected and edge-case scenarios.  Identify performance issues through manual testing and highlight any bottlenecks or slow response times, which could affect user experience or application efficiency.  Work closely with developers, product managers, and other team members to communicate identified issues, discuss requirements, and contribute feedback to enhance the product quality.  Maintain comprehensive test documentation, including detailed test cases, test execution logs, defect reports, and status updates, ensuring transparent communication with stakeholders.  Manually test the user interface for consistency, usability, and adherence to design specifications, ensuring that the application provides a seamless and intuitive user experience.  Ensure the software adheres to relevant industry standards, legal requirements, accessibility guidelines, and organizational quality control procedures.  Actively contribute to Agile ceremonies, such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint retrospectives, and backlog grooming, ensuring that testing aligns with project timelines and objectives.   ACADEMIC PROFILE: Masters in Computer Application from Adhiyamaan College of Engineering at Hosur. (Aug 2015 to Apr 2018)
